    Inferential analysis is a Statistical approach, used to make predictions or draw conclusions about a larger population based on sample data.

    It involves techniques like hypothesis testing, confidence intervals, and regression analysis to determine how likely it is that observed patterns in the sample reflect true characteristics of the population.
